media:group.media:description:
ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีจ ึ ีีซีกึีตีกีฌ ีีกีฐีกีถีฃีถีฅึีจ ีฝีฟีธึีกีฃึีฅึีซีถ ยซีีกีฆีดีกีพีกึีกีฏีกีถ ีฃีธึีฎีจีถีฏีฅึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีดีกีฝีซีถ ีฏีกีถีธีถีกีคึีธึีฉีตีธึีถยป ีฏีธีนีพีธีฒ ึีกีฝีฟีกีฉีธึีฒีฉีจึ ีีกีทีซีถีฃีฟีธีถีธึีดี ิฑีี ีบีฅีฟึีกึีฟีธึีฒีกึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีธึีด ีฏีกีตีกึีกีฎ ีกึีกึีธีฒีธึีฉีตีกีถีจ ึีกีฝีฟีกีฉีฒีฉีซ ีฟีกีฏ ีซึีฅีถึ ีฝีฟีธึีกีฃึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ ีคึีฅึีซีถ ิฑีี ีบีฅีฟึีกึีฟีธึีฒีกึ ิทีถีฉีธีถีซ ิฒีฌีซีถึีฅีถีจ ึ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีกึีฟีฃีธึีฎีถีกีญีกึีกึ ิฑึีกึีกีฟ ีีซึีฆีธีตีกีถีจึ
In a ceremony held at the U.S. State Department in Washington, Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Armenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan signed the โStrategic Partnership Charter,โ marking a significant milestone in bilateral relations.
The comprehensive partnership, as outlined by Secretary Blinken, rests on four main pillars: economic cooperation, security and defense collaboration, democratic development, and people-to-people exchanges. A key economic highlight is the upcoming negotiations for a โ123 Agreement,โ establishing a legal framework for peaceful nuclear cooperation, including transferring nuclear materials, equipment, and technology under strict security protocols.
On security matters, Blinken announced that a U.S. Customs and Border Patrol team would visit Armenia next month to support capacity-building efforts. The partnership builds on existing military cooperation, including the annual โEagle Partnerโ bilateral exercises.
As part of the agreement, Armenia will join the Global Coalition to Defeat ISIS, becoming the 88th member of this international security alliance.
โThe Armenian government demonstrates a real commitment to building a more just society. I particularly want to note the work of Prime Minister Pashinyan and his government in implementing reforms in critical areas, especially in justice and law enforcement. Last month at the State Department, we had the honor of presenting one of our anti-corruption leadership awards for exceptional work in fighting corruption,โ Blinken stated.
Blinken emphasized that this strategic partnership โwill contribute to forming a more resilient, peaceful, and independent South Caucasus. We are becoming increasingly strong partners, and I believe this serves the interests of both our countries, as well as the region and beyond.โ
Foreign Minister Mirzoyan highlighted the significance of the charter: โThe Armenia-U.S. Strategic Partnership Charter we are signing today provides a robust framework and brings greater ambition to our cooperation.โ
โOur relations, based on shared values and mutual interests, have shown remarkable growth in recent years, maturing to a point where upgrading them to a strategic partnership is not only fitting but essential for navigating the complex geopolitical landscape,โ Mirzoyan noted. โWe deeply appreciate the United Statesโ unwavering support for Armeniaโs independence, sovereignty, and territorial integrity.โ
Mirzoyan concluded by expressing Armeniaโs commitment to the peace agenda and its implementation, emphasizing that the charter would serve as both a testament to deepening strategic relations and a roadmap for a future of shared achievements between the two nations. #CivilNet #ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉ

ยซ2024-ีซึ ีดีฅีฏีถีกึีฏีกีฎ ึีซีฆีซีฏีกีฏีกีถ ีกีถีฑีกีถึ ีฅีฏีกีดีธึีฟีถีฅึีซ ีฐีกีดีจีถีคีฐีกีถีธึึ ีฐีกีตีฟีกึีกึีกีฃึีดีกีถ ีฐีกีดีกีฏีกึีฃีซ ีฅึีฏึีธึีค ึีธึีฌีธึีด ีฅีถึยป,- ยซีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉ ีขีซีฆีถีฅีฝีซยป ีฐีฅีฟ ีฆึีธึีตึีธึีด ีกีฝีธึีด ีง ีีฅีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีฅีฏีกีดีธึีฟีถีฅึีซ ีฏีธีดีซีฟีฅีซ (ีิติฟ) ึีธีญีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐ ีีกึีกีตีฅีฌ ิณึีธึีฃีตีกีถีจ: ีีก ีถีทีธึีด ีง, ีธึ ีดีซีถีนึ 2025-ีซ ีดีกีตีซีฝีซ 1-ีจ ีกีถีฐึีกีชีฅีทีฟ ีง ีถีฅึีฏีกีตีกึีถีฅีฌ 2024-ีซ ีฐีกีทีพีฅีฟีธึ ีฟีกึีพีก ีฐีกีตีฟีกึีกึีกีฃึีฅึีจ:
ิตีฏีกีดีธึีฟีถีฅึีซ ีฐีกีตีฟีกึีกึีกีฃึีธึีดีจ ีพีฅึีกีขีฅึีธึีด ีง ีฃึีกีถึีพีกีฎ ีขีธีฌีธึ ีกีทีญีกีฟีธีฒีถีฅึีซีถึ ีึีกีถึ ีบีฅีฟึ ีง ีฐีกีตีฟีกึีกึีกีฃึีฅีถ 2024-ีซีถ ีฝีฟีกึีกีฎ ีฅีฏีกีดีธึีฟีถีฅึีจ:

entry.title: Armenia not leaving Eurasian Economic Union, ministers say

media:group.media:title: Armenia not leaving Eurasian Economic Union, ministers say
media:group.media:description:
๐ Armenia's Economy Minister Gevorg Papoyan declared today that Armenia has no current plans to exit the Russian-led Eurasian Economic Union, while emphasizing that the country's potential EU membership pursuit would run parallel to existing commitments. ๐ Yerevan Mayor Tigran Avinyan reimbursed roughly $19,000 to the municipal budget after controversy erupted over his business trip to Los Angeles in November, when taxpayer funds were used to purchase an expensive flight without conducting the required competitive bidding process for the contract.

entry.title: Armenia boosts tech sector with $80 million annual tax break package

media:group.media:title: Armenia boosts tech sector with $80 million annual tax break package
media:group.media:description:
๐ A senior Russian official warned Armenia that joining the European Union would be โincompatibleโ with staying in the Eurasian Economic Union. Armeniaโs economy remains highly dependent on Russia, and leaving the Kremlin-led bloc would have broad economic impacts for the country. ๐ A senior Armenian official said he expects local tech companies to keep about $80 million every year that would otherwise be taken as tax, after parliament passed a new package of tax breaks for the countryโs burgeoning IT sector.

media:group.media:description:
ีีฅึีปีซีถ ีทึีปีกีถีธึีด ีฝีธึึีกีถึีฅึีธึีด ิตึึีกีถีซ ึ ีคีซ ีกีฒีฟีธีฟีพีกีฎีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฏีกีบีพีกีฎ ึีถีถีกึีฏีธึีดีถีฅึีจ ีนีฅีถ ีคีกีคีกึีธึีดึ ิปีถีนีบีซีฝีซีีถ ีง ีดีกีตึีกึีกีฒีกึีซ ึ ีคีซ ีธึีกีฏีจ, ีกึีชีฅี ีกึีคีตีธึ ีกีถีฐีกีถีฃีฝีฟีกีถีกีฌ, ึ ีซีถีนีบีฅีีฝ ีฅีถ ีกึีพีธึีด ึ ีคีซ ีธึีกีฏีซ ีฐีฅีฟีกีฆีธีฟีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีจึ ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ีฟีกีฒีกีพีกึีธึีด ีง ิทีฏีธีฌีธีฃีกีถีธีธีฝึีฅึีกีตีซีถ ีฐีฅีฟีกีฆีธีฟีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซ ีฏีฅีถีฟึีธีถีซ ีฟีถึ ึีฅีถ ิผีซีฌีซีฉ ีีกีฐีกีฏีตีกีถีจึ ีีก ีทีฅีทีฟีธึีด ีงี ีกีฒีฟีธีฟีพีกีฎีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีญีถีคีซึีถ ีธึีถีซ ีฐีกีดีกีฏีกึีฃีกีตีซีถ ีดีธีฟีฅึีดีกีถ, ีฟีกึีกีฎึีกีตีซีถ ีฃึีกีฃีฅีฟ ีบีฌีกีถีกีพีธึีดีกีถ ีฏีกึีซึึ

media:group.media:title: ิณีตีธึีดึีซ. ีฝีบีธึีฟีซ ีธึ ีกีผีธีฒีปีธึีฉีตีกีถ ึีถีถีกึีฏีธึีด ีกีดีฅีถีกีฝีบีธึีฟีกีตีซีถ ึีกีฒีกึีธึีด
media:group.media:description:
ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีจ ยซีีฅีฎ ีฐีกึึีฅึยป ีญีธึีกีฃึีธีพ ึีถีถีกึีฏีธึีดีถีฅึีซ ีทีกึึ ีง ีถีฅึีฏีกีตีกึีถีธึีด, ีธึีธีถึีซึ ีฅึึีธึีคีจ ีฟีฅีฒีซ ีง ีธึีถีฅึีฅีฌ ีคีฅีฏีฟีฅีดีขีฅึีซ 19-ีซีถ ิณีตีธึีดึีซีธึีดี ยซีีบีธึีฟ ึ ีกีผีธีฒีปีธึีฉีตีธึีถยป ีฉีฅีดีกีตีธีพึ ีีถีถีกึีฏีธึีดีจ ีพีกึีธึีด ีง reึarrange ึีธีคึีกีฝีฟีซ ีฐีซีดีถีกีคีซึ ีีกึีฅีฏ ิฑีดีซึีญีกีถีตีกีถีจึ
ยซีีฅีฎ ีฐีกึึีฅึยป ีทีกึึีซ ีฅึึีธึีค ีฐีกีถีคีซีบีดีกีถ ีฉีฅีดีกีถ ีง ยซีีบีธึีฟ ึ ีกีผีธีฒีปีธึีฉีตีธึีถยปึ ีีตีธึึีฅึีถ ีฅีถี ีฎีกีถึีธึีค, ีกีทีญีกึีฐีซ ีนีฅีดีบีซีธีถ, ิตีพึีธีบีกีตีซ ีฏึีฏีถีกีฏีซ ีนีฅีดีบีซีธีถ ีีกีฆีซีฏ ิฑีพีคีกีฌีตีกีถีจ, ีฌีธีฒีธึีค ีีกึีฝีฅีถีซีฏ ีีกีถีธึีนีกึีตีกีถีจ, ีฐีธึีถีกีฐีผีธีดีฅีกีฏีกีถ ีธีณีซ ีจีดีขีทีกีดีกึีฟีซ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีฐีกีพีกึีกีฏีกีถีซ ีดีกึีฆีซีน ิณึีธึีฃ ิฑีฌีฅึีฝีกีถีตีกีถีจ, ิฑีฆีฃีกีตีซีถ ิบีธีฒีธีพีซ ยซีีกีฒีกึีกึีซีกีฏีกีถ ีบีกีตีดีกีถีกีฃีซึยป ีญีดีขีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีบีกีฟีฃีกีดีกีพีธึ ิฑึีฝีฅีถ ินีธึีธีฝีตีกีถีจ, ีฝึีฟีกีขีกีถ-ีกีผีซีฉีดีธีฌีธีฃ ีีกีฉึีซีฏ ีีธีพีกีฏีซีดีตีกีถีจ ึ ีีซึีกีฏีซ ีดีกึีฆีบีฅีฟีกึีกีถีซ ีกีทีญีกีฟีกีฏีกีฆีดีซ ิฟึีฉีธึีฉีตีกีถ, ีดีทีกีฏีธึีตีฉีซ ึ ีฝีบีธึีฟีซ ีพีกึีนีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฃีฌีญีกีพีธึ ีดีกีฝีถีกีฃีฅีฟ, ีฝีบีธึีฟีซ ีพีกีฝีฟีกีฏีกีพีธึ ีฃีธึีฎีซีน ีีกีนีกีฃีกีถ ีีกึีคีกีถีตีกีถีจึ
